headline: The Bull Case For Corteva (CTVA) Could Change Following Bayer Settlement And Licensing Shift – Learn Why
summary: Corteva, Inc. reported fourth-quarter 2025 sales of US$3,910 million and a net loss of US$552 million, but delivered full-year sales of US$17,401 million and net income of US$1,094 million, while affirming 2026 operating EPS guidance of US$3.45 to US$3.70 and maintaining a US$0.18 per-share dividend declared for March 2026. The company also finalized a comprehensive settlement with Bayer, paying US$610 million to resolve seed freedom-to-operate disputes and unlock expanded licensing...

The company also finalized a comprehensive settlement with Bayer, paying US$610 million to resolve seed freedom-to-operate disputes and unlock expanded licensing...

headline: Iowa econ chief Debi Durham talks about quest to land Corteva spinoff
summary: A seed operation company is being spun off from Corteva. State economic development chief Debi Durham wants its HQ back in Iowa.

headline: Corteva Q4 Earnings Call Highlights
summary: Corteva (NYSE:CTVA) executives highlighted a “strong year” in 2025, progress toward a planned second-half separation, and an updated 2026 outlook during the company’s fourth-quarter earnings call.
